sen.j: 猿丸太夫（さるまるのたいふ、さるまるだゆう、生没年不詳）は、三十六歌仙の一人。
sen.e: Sarumaru no Taifu, or Sarumarudayu (years of birth and death not know) was one of the thirty-six immortal poets.
Sarumaru no Taifu, or Sarumarudayu (years of birth and death not know) was one of the thirty-six immortal poets.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Sarumaru no Taifu, or Sarumarudayu (years of birth and death not know) was one of the thirty-six immortal poets.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 猿丸は名、太夫は官位を表している。
sen.e: Sarumaru is his name, and Taifu means a official rank.
Sarumaru is his given name, and Taifu his official rank.
sen.cmt: Cut "means". Added "given" to "name".
sen.e: Sarumaru is his given name, and Taifu his official rank.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 元明天皇時代、または元慶年間ころの人物とも言われるが、本当に実在した人物かどうかすら不明の、謎の人物。
sen.e: Although it is told that he was a person who lived in the era of the Emperor Genmei or the period around Gangyo era, he is a mysterious person for whom it is not known whether or not he really existed.

Although it is told that he was a person who lived in the era of the Emperor Genmei or the period around Gangyo era, he is a mysterious person for whom it is not known whether or not he really existed.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Although it is told that he was a person who lived in the era of the Emperor Genmei or the period around Gangyo era, he is a mysterious person for whom it is not known whether or not he really existed.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 天智天皇の皇子施基皇子、聖徳太子の孫弓削王との説もあるが、伝承上の人物との説が最も多く使われている。
sen.e: There are views that he was Shikinomiko who was a son of the Emperor Tenchi, or Yuge no Okimi, who was a grandson of Prince Shotoku, but most widely used view is that he is a legendary person.

There are views that he was Shikinomiko who was a son of the Emperor Tenchi, or Yuge no Okimi, who was a grandson of Prince Shotoku, but most widely used view is that he is simply a mythological figure.
sen.cmt: "Legendary person"-"mythological figure".
sen.e: There are views that he was Shikinomiko, a son of the Emperor Tenchi, or Yuge no Okimi, a grandson of Prince Shotoku, but the view accepted most widely is that he is simply a mythological figure.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 異説として柿本人麻呂説があるが空想の域を出ておらず、研究者らの支持を得られていない。
sen.e: There is a heresy that he KAKINOMOTO no Hitomaro, but it is no more than a flight of fancy and it could not receive support from researchers.
There is an opinion that he KAKINOMOTO no Hitomaro, but it is little more than a fantasy and is given no credence by academics.
sen.cmt: "Flight of fancy"-"fantasy". "could not receive support from researchers."-"is given no credence by academics".
sen.e: There is an opinion that he is KAKINOMOTO no Hitomaro, but it is little more than a fantasy and is given no credence by academics.
sen.cmt: isを追加。

sen.j: 「三十六人集」の中に『猿丸大夫集』なるものがあるが、後人による雑纂古歌集であり、その中の歌が猿丸大夫が作ったものであるかは検証が必要である。
sen.e: Although "Sarumarutayushu" is included in "Sanjurokunin-shu," it is a collection of miscellaneous old waka by a later compiler and, therefore, it is necessary to verify if waka in it was really composed by Sarumaru no Taifu.

Although Sarumarutayushu is included in Sanjurokunin-shu, it is a collection of miscellaneous old waka by a later compiler and, therefore, it is necessary to verify if the waka in it was really composed by Sarumaru no Taifu or not.
sen.cmt: Removed quotation marks. "The waka". Added "or not" to read a little smoother.
sen.e: Although "Sarumarutayushu" is included in "Sanjurokunin-shu," it is a collection of miscellaneous old waka by a later compiler and, therefore, it is necessary to verify if the waka in it was really composed by Sarumaru no Taifu or not.
sen.cmt: 引用符を戻しました。

tit.j: 猿丸大夫作と言われる歌
tit.e: Waka which is told to have been composed by Sarumaru no Taifu
Waka which is said to have been composed by Sarumaru no Taifu
Waka which is said to have been composed by Sarumaru no Taifu

sen.j: 「もみじに鹿」の取り合わせは、この歌から始まった。
sen.e: Combination of "maple leaf and deer" derived from this waka.
This waka is derived from a combination of "maple leaf and deer"
sen.cmt: Rewrote to read more naturally.
sen.e: This waka is the first appearance of a combination of "maple leaf and deer."
sen.cmt: 原文の意味が明確になるように書き換えました。

tit.j: 猿丸太夫＝柿本人麻呂説
tit.e: View that Sarumaru no Taifu was KAKINOMOTO no Hitomaro
The view that Sarumaru no Taifu was KAKINOMOTO no Hitomaro
The view that Sarumaru no Taifu was KAKINOMOTO no Hitomaro

sen.j: 謎の多いこの二人について、哲学者の梅原猛が『水底の歌-柿本人麻呂論』において同一人物との論を発表して以来、少なからず同調する者もいる。
sen.e: With respect to those two mysterious persons, since a philosopher Takeshi UMEHARA published his view in "Mizusoko no uta - a View on KAKINOMOTO no Hitomaro" that they were a same person a considerable number of researchers supported this view.
sen.cmt: "水底の歌" 正しい読み不明
sen.e: With respect to these two mysterious persons, since the philosopher Takeshi UMEHARA published his view in Mizusoko no uta - a View on KAKINOMOTO no Hitomaro that they were a same person a considerable number of researchers have supported this view.
sen.cmt: Removed quotation marks. "Those"-"these". "Have supported".
sen.e: Since Takeshi UMEHARA, a philosopher, expressed his view concerning these two mysterious persons in his book, "Mizusoko no uta - a View on KAKINOMOTO no Hitomaro," that they were the same person, a considerable number of researchers have supported this view.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 梅原説は、過去に日本で神と崇められた者に尋常な死をとげたものはいないという柳田国男の主張に着目している。
sen.e: In the view of UMEHARA, the theses of Kunio YANAGIDA that nobody who was worshiped as a god died normally, was taken into consideration.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the view of UMEHARA, the theses of Kunio YANAGIDA that nobody who was worshiped as a god died normally, was taken into consideration.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: In the view of UMEHARA, the theses of Kunio YANAGIDA that nobody who was worshiped as a god died normally, was taken into consideration.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 人麻呂が和歌の神・水難の神として祀られたことから、持統天皇や藤原不比等から政治的に粛清されたものとしている。
sen.e: The view understood that as Hitomaro was worshipped as the god of waka and the god of rescue from water accidents, he was politically purged by the Empress Jito and FUJIWARA no Fuhito.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The view understood that as Hitomaro was worshipped as the god of waka and the god of protection at sea, he was politically purged by the Empress Jito and FUJIWARA no Fuhito.
sen.cmt: Not 100% sure if it is accurate, but I thought "god of protection at sea" would at least read a bit more naturally here.
sen.e: Because Hitomaro was worshipped as the god of waka poetry and the god of protection at sea, he was politically purged by the Empress Jito and FUJIWARA no Fuhito.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 人麻呂が『古今和歌集』の真名序では「柿本太夫」と記されている点も取り上げている。
sen.e: It also pointed out that Hitomaro was called as "Kakimoto no Taifu" in the preface, written in Chinese, to the "Kokin wakashu" (Collected Waka from Ancient and Modern Times).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It also pointed out that Hitomaro was called as "Kakimoto no Taifu" in the preface, written in Chinese, to the "Kokin wakashu" (Collected Waka from Ancient and Modern Times).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: It also pointed out that Hitomaro was called as 'Kakimoto no Taifu' in the preface written in Chinese to "Kokin wakashu" (Collected Waka from Ancient and Modern Times).
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 三十六歌仙の一人と言われながら猿丸太夫作と断定出来る歌が一つもない（奥山も太夫作ではないとする説も多い）。
sen.e: As there is no waka that we can definitely say Sarumaru no Taifu composed it although he was called as one of the thirty-six immortal poets (many support the view that waka of okuyama was not composed by Sarumaru Taifu), this view advocates that people were afraid of the power that killed Hitomaro and called him with a difference name, Sarumaru.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As there is no waka that we can definitely say was composed by Sarumaru no Taifu, although he was called as one of the thirty-six immortal poets (many support the view that waka of okuyama was not composed by Sarumaru Taifu), this view advocates that people were afraid of the power that killed Hitomaro and called him with a difference name, Sarumaru.
sen.cmt: Changed to "that we can definitely say was composed by Sarumaru no Taifu" to read more naturally.
sen.e: Although he was called as one of the thirty-six immortal poets, there is no waka poem that we can definitely say that it was composed by Sarumaru no Taifu (many support the view that waka poem of okuyama was not composed by Sarumaru Taifu).
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: そのため、彼を死に至らしめた権力側をはばかり彼の名を猿丸太夫と別名で呼んだ説である。
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Therefore there is a view that people were afraid of the power that killed Hitomaro and called him by a difference name, Sarumaru.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: しかしながらこの説が主張するように、政治的な粛清に人麻呂があったのなら、当然ある程度の官位（正史に残る五位以上の位階）を人麻呂が有していたと考えるのが必然である。
sen.e: If Hitomaro was politically purged as advocated by this view, however, it is logical to consider that Hitomaro had a certain level of official rank (not lower than the Fifth Rank) that should be recorded in the official history.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: If Hitomaro was politically purged as advocated by this view, however, it is logical to consider that Hitomaro had a certain level of official rank (not lower than the Fifth Rank) that should have been recorded in the official history.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 正史に人麻呂の記述が無い点を指摘し、無理があると考える識者の数が圧倒的に多い。
sen.e: Overwhelming majority of informed circles believe, pointing out the fact that there is no record on KAKINOMOTO no Hitomaro in the official history, that the above-described view is illogical.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The overwhelming majority of informed circles believe, pointing out the fact that there is no record on KAKINOMOTO no Hitomaro in the official history, that the view described above is illogical.
sen.cmt: "Above-described view"-"view described above".
sen.e: The overwhelming majority of informed circles believe that the view described above is illogical, pointing out the fact that there is no record on KAKINOMOTO no Hitomaro in the official history.
